info.name: 2024 Way of the Swordsage Monk Subclass
info.description: The Way of the Swordsage Monk Subclass from the Middle Finger of Vecna / Mage Hand Press for 5e14, adapted to 2024 Player's Handbook Monk.
info.author: Middle Finger of Vecna / Mage Hand Press

description.p: A master of martial maneuvers, Swordsage Warriors are a physically adept â€” a blade wizard whose knowledge of the Sublime Way lets her unlock blinding speed and spiritual transcendence. Unlike other monks, the Swordsage trains with his weapon as well as his martial arts, practicing relentless discipline to hone her skills and perfect her combat maneuvers. The Masters of the Sublime way are a blur of deadly strikes on the battlefield, evidence of years of intensive training and meditation.

When you choose this path at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in martial weapons that do not have the Heavy property. Martial weapons are also treated as monk weapons for the purposes of monk class features.
Beginning at 3rd level, your training and discipline have taught you to channel your Focus into deadly combat maneuvers.
Maneuvers. You learn five maneuvers of your choice from the list of maneuvers available to the Battle Master. You can use only one maneuver per attack.
You learn two additional maneuvers of your choice at 6th, 11th, and 17th level.

Superiority Dice. You have four superiority dice, which are based on your Martial Arts die, and increase in size when they do. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest.

Saving Throws. Some of your maneuvers require your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows: Maneuver save DC = DC equals 8 plus your Wisdom modifier and Proficiency Bonus.

sheet.description: You learn five maneuvers and have {{superiority dice:amount}} d{{martial arts:dice}} superiority dice to fuel them. You regain expended dice on a short or long rest.

description.p: By 6th level, you are exceptionally quick to act, and have advantage on initiative rolls.

At 11th level, you can strike an enemy within the span of a moment. As a bonus action, you can spend 2 Focus points to teleport up to 60 feet to a space that you can see adjacent to an enemy. You then have advantage on the first attack you make before the end of your turn.

description.p: By 17th level, you have mastered the Sublime Way and can strike with perfect form. You may now use two different maneuvers on a single attack, expending Ki points separately for each.
